Platform and Partnership Updates With the Holidays in full swing and the Year’s End quickly approaching, on behalf of all of us here at Turbonomic: THANK YOU, our customers, for your trust and partnership.
While 2018 has been an incredibly exciting year, we’re already looking forward to all that 2019 will hold! This includes helping you achieve your 2019 cloud goals… and beyond! For example, did you know that our real-time capabilities and AI-driven decision engine enables the best use of reserved capacity in AWS <[[https://resources.turbonomic.com/optimize-public-cloud-spend/live-demo-featuring-new-continuous-aws-reserved-instance-consumption]]> and Azure? To take advantage of this powerful capability, maximize the value you’re getting from the Turbonomic platform and much more, be sure that you’re running Turbonomic 6.2. And, remember that your Turbonomic maintenance includes upgrades and updates. Reach out to our team and get access to the very latest.
See it in action with an example Optimize Plan for AWS here <[[https://vimeo.com/305765768]]>. News and Customer Success We are very excited to welcome Ian Penny, the CIO of Hiscox and former CTO of Barclays, to Turbonomic's Board of Directors. Not only does Ian have experience leading major digital transformation and cloud initiatives for international multi-billion dollar companies - but he also has multiple experiences as a Turbonomic customer. We’re excited to draw from Ian’s invaluable customer-centric viewpoint, which will help us deliver our customers, like you, a world-class experience.
With yet another AWS re:Invent 2018 having come and gone, the opportunities that cloud (whether AWS or Azure) offers have never been greater. Our CMO, Tom Murphy, made an appearance on SiliconAngle’s theCUBE <[[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DCE9aR2kga0&t=272s]]> during re:Invent, where he discussed the opportunities, challenges, and considerations customers like you are facing during your cloud journey – and the role modern workload management plays.
Want to learn more about how to design and deploy infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS) solutions in the cloud using AWS? This eBook will take you through practical examples, design patterns, and tips to help you confidently build a working IaaS solution!
